examples: The students worked their heart and soul on their project.
Not working my foot.
Soymilk works well as a substitute for milk in sauces and creamy pasta dishes.
My dad works forty hours a week.
To work clay.
words.defineEn: to do a job or task, usually for a company or organization, in order to receive money
words.defineVi: thực hiện một công việc hoặc nhiệm vụ, thường là cho một công ty hoặc tổ chức, để nhận tiền

examples: They set up a table outside the café for al fresco dining.
We set up a swing set in the yard.
Have you set up the DVD player?
You have to set up the software to fit the company like a glove.
Roadblocks have been set up in an effort to capture several convicts who went over the wall.
words.defineEn: to establish or start something
words.defineVi: để thiết lập hoặc bắt đầu một cái gì đó

words.defineEn: to perform or succeed in a satisfactory or commendable manner
words.defineVi: để thực hiện hoặc thành công một cách thỏa đáng hoặc đáng khen ngợi

examples: The unemployed man took a job he didn't like because he needed to pay his bills.
The number of unemployed has passed the two million mark for the first time.
I know the job isn't perfect, but a bad bush is better than the open field, and I can't afford to be unemployed right now.
The unemployed man was offered a job that was not ideal, but he accepted it because beggars can't be choosers.
The government is accused of ratting on its promises to the unemployed.
words.defineEn: not having a job
words.defineVi: không có việc làm

examples: People are looking for ways to save money.
The president is looking for staff who will give him advice straight from the shoulder.
Are you still looking for a job?
We'll have to look for a better solution.
She is looking for a part-time job to earn extra money.
words.defineEn: to try to find something or someone
words.defineVi: để cố gắng tìm một cái gì đó hoặc một ai đó

examples: His carelessness lost him the job.
Jobs that pay £5 an hour.
This job puts years on you.
My job is the tough one.
The team's new manager brings ten years' experience to the job.
words.defineEn: the work that we do regularly to earn money
words.defineVi: công việc mà chúng tôi làm thường xuyên để kiếm tiền

words.defineEn: dismissed or fired from employment, typically due to poor performance, misconduct, or other reasons specified by the employer
words.defineVi: sa thải hoặc sa thải khỏi công việc, thường là do hoạt động kém, hành vi sai trái hoặc các lý do khác do người sử dụng lao động chỉ định

examples: On his suggestion, I applied for the job.
Some of us, though, actually have to apply for jobs.
He applied a few drops of spikenard oil to his temples, finding relief from his headache.
She applied lip balm to moisturize her dry lips.
He applied toothpaste to his toothbrush and started brushing his teeth in circular motions.
words.defineEn: to formally request something, such as a place at a university, a job, etc.
words.defineVi: để chính thức yêu cầu một cái gì đó, chẳng hạn như một vị trí tại một trường đại học, một công việc, v.v.

examples: With Betty's salary they barely made ends meet.
I was living in cloud-cuckoo-land about my salary expectations.
He was able to negotiate a healthily high salary for his new job.
She had never been able to save much from her salary.
The software company was having trouble finding developers who could write quality code, but they were only offering salaries that were well below market rates.
words.defineEn: an amount of money we receive for doing our job, usually monthly
words.defineVi: một số tiền chúng tôi nhận được để thực hiện công việc của mình, thường là hàng tháng

examples: The boss has a short fuse these days!
The boss was clear about the deadline for the project, with no ifs, ands, or buts.
The boss of the failed company is keeping schtum about his role in the disaster.
My boss finally let me in on the plans for the new project.
The boss sure aired his lungs when we lost another customer!
words.defineEn: a person who is in charge of a large organization or has an important position there
words.defineVi: một người phụ trách một tổ chức lớn hoặc có một vị trí quan trọng ở đó

examples: 95 per cent of the UK can now get superfast broadband.
This room gets very little sunshine.
Get a load of that dress Mag!
Get a load of George over there.
The police got wind of the illegal drug deal.
words.defineEn: to receive or come to have something
words.defineVi: để nhận hoặc đến để có một cái gì đó

examples: Does this pub do lunches?
Does this pub do lunches?
Does the price include tax?
Microprocessors do the calculations in the twinkling of an eye.
The gang did a warehouse and a supermarket.
words.defineEn: to perform a particular activity or task
words.defineVi: để thực hiện một hoạt động cụ thể hoặc nhiệm vụ

examples: When I told Jack that he had to work overtime again, he looked at me with a face like a bulldog chewing a wasp.
He's trying to get back in his boss's good books by offering to work overtime.
After working overtime and completing the project ahead of schedule, the team was given a bonus because a good dog deserves a good bone.
This is really one of the main changes overtime.
The longer, you're kind of stuck at home, the less likely you're going to pay overtime.
words.defineEn: the extra hours a person works at their job
words.defineVi: thêm giờ một người làm việc tại công việc của họ

examples: We won’t be promoting Larry.
She teaches yoga to promote health and well-being.
The organization is committed to promoting equality and fairness for every person.
Anna was promoted to manager last year, and she's been in the fast lane ever since.
Earth Day is observed on April 22nd to promote environmental awareness.
words.defineEn: to move to a higher position or rank
words.defineVi: để di chuyển đến một vị trí cao hơn hoặc xếp hạng

examples: In the wake of the scandal, several committee members resigned.
She resigned.
so I resigned as secretary of the golf club.
He ought to resign, I think.
The stock market went haywire after the company's CEO resigned.
words.defineEn: to officially announce one's departure from a job, position, etc.
words.defineVi: để thông báo chính thức về sự ra đi của một người từ một công việc, vị trí, v.v.

examples: Employees can retire at 60 if they choose.
Jim retired to raise raspberries.
When the CEO retired, the board of directors made the mistake of promoting the inexperienced intern to take his place.
Since he retired, Bill has too much time on his hands.
Even though I’ve retired, I still get up at 7 am by force of habit.
words.defineEn: to leave one's job and stop working, usually on reaching a certain age
words.defineVi: rời bỏ công việc của một người và ngừng làm việc, thường là khi đến một độ tuổi nhất định

examples: The local bus company only runs a skeleton service on Sundays.
The college runs summer courses for foreign students.
The college also runs evening classes in bricklaying and joinery.
The bookcase runs the length of the room.
The tabloid press ran the story.
words.defineEn: to manage and organize something such as a business, campaign, etc.
words.defineVi: để quản lý và tổ chức một cái gì đó chẳng hạn như một doanh nghiệp, chiến dịch, vv

examples: That's kinda redundant with the last one.
They installed three redundant power supplies, three separate water sources and a water filtration system, aquaponic farming, and hydroponic food.
You know, it's kind of redundant.
It's kind of redundant, but I'll rewrite it f of 1 is undefined.
These menus are often redundant, and it can be confusing to figure out where to find each setting.
words.defineEn: surpassing what is needed or required, and so, no longer of use
words.defineVi: vượt quá những gì cần thiết hoặc bắt buộc, và do đó, không còn sử dụng nữa

examples: This encore presentation is part of our series Work Shift.
Paul Solman has the story for our series Work Shift.
Paul Solman reports for our series Work Shift on navigating a post-COVID economy.
Paul Solman has our report for our series Work Shift, which focuses on navigating the job market in a post-COVID economy.
Paul Solman has the story for our series Work Shift, which focuses on navigating the job market in a post-COVID economy.
words.defineEn: the time that a person is required to be working or present at work
words.defineVi: thời gian mà một người được yêu cầu phải làm việc hoặc có mặt tại nơi làm việc

examples: The freelance investigative reporter made a career of digging up dirt on celebrities for tabloids.
While raising her children, she kept her finger on the pulse of business and technology by freelancing for start-ups and small businesses.
MALCOLM BRABANT: Jago and Gus' mother is freelance writer Flora Watkins.
I had just gotten a couple of freelance writing assignments.
Companies like HackerOne, Bugcrowd and Synack have sprung up to connect freelance hackers with corporations that offer bug bounty programs.
words.defineEn: an individual who works independently without having a long-term contract with companies
words.defineVi: một cá nhân làm việc độc lập mà không có hợp đồng dài hạn với các công ty

words.defineEn: working less hours than what is standard or customary
words.defineVi: làm việc ít giờ hơn tiêu chuẩn hoặc thông lệ

words.defineEn: working for oneself rather than for another
words.defineVi: làm việc cho chính mình hơn là cho người khác

examples: I enjoyed the temporary exhibition at the museum, which featured contemporary art from around the world.
He was sitting as a temporary judge.
He traced patterns in the sand with his foot, leaving temporary imprints.
He felt a sense of relief when the doctor assured him that his stomach issue was temporary.

The family who lost their home in a natural disaster had to live in a temporary shelter for several months, but they endured the difficult circumstances with patience and resilience, knowing that what cannot be cured must be endured.
words.defineEn: an individual who is employed for a limited time
words.defineVi: một cá nhân được tuyển dụng trong một thời gian giới hạn
